SEARCH

Klasse Dialog

java.lang.Object
Dialog
public class Dialog extends Object
The Dialog class provides the dialog with the user. The user is asked for the input data for the CNF problem.

  • Methodendetails

    • startDialog

      public InputData startDialog() throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
      Starts the dialog with the user. The user is asked for the input data for the CNF problem.
      Gibt zurück:
      The input data for the CNF problem.
      Löst aus:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - If the solver times out.

    • askForSeed

      private long askForSeed()
      Asks user which seed to use
      Gibt zurück:
      the input seed

    • askForCountSolver

      private String askForCountSolver()
      Asks the user which counting solver to use.
      Gibt zurück:
      The selected counting solver

    • askWantFamilies

      private boolean askWantFamilies()
      Asks the user if he wants to use family rules.
      Gibt zurück:
      True if the user wants to use family rules, false otherwise.

    • askHowManyVariables

      private int askHowManyVariables()
      Asks the user for the number of variables in the CNF problem.
      Gibt zurück:
      The number of variables in the CNF problem.

    • askForFamilySize

      private int[] askForFamilySize()
      Asks the user for the minimum and maximum size of the families.
      Gibt zurück:
      An array containing the minimum and maximum size of the families. Example: [1, 4] = 1-4

    • generateAndPrintFamilyRules

      private List<int[]> generateAndPrintFamilyRules(int numberOfVariables, int minFamSize, int maxFamSize, Random rand)
      Generates the family rules for the CNF problem and prints them to the console. The size of the families are randomly determined in range minFamSize to maxFamSize. The actual family rules are generated by calling the buildFamilyRules method.
      Parameter:
      numberOfVariables - The number of variables in the CNF problem.
      minFamSize - The minimum size of a family.
      maxFamSize - The maximum size of a family.
      rand - the random generator
      Gibt zurück:
      A list of family rules.

    • buildFamilyRules

      private List<int[]> buildFamilyRules(int[] family)
      Generates the family rules for a given family. The family rules are generated by combining the variables of the family with each other. For example, if the family is [1, 2, 3], the family rules are [[1, 2, 3], [-1, -2], [-1, -3], [-2, -3]]. Represents an XOR constraint between the variables of the family.
      Parameter:
      family - The family for which the family rules should be generated.
      Gibt zurück:
      A list of family rules.

    • getAndPrintVariance

      private BigInteger getAndPrintVariance(List<int[]> familyRules, int numberOfVariables, int minFamilySize, int maxFamilySize, String countSolver, Random rand)
      Calculates the variance of the family rules and prints it to the console. If the variance cannot be calculated, new family rules are generated and the method is called again.
      Parameter:
      familyRules - The family rules.
      numberOfVariables - The number of variables in the CNF problem.
      minFamilySize - The minimum size of a family.
      maxFamilySize - The maximum size of a family.
      countSolver - the counting solver that should be used
      rand - the random generator
      Gibt zurück:
      The variance of the family rules as BigInteger.

    • askForGoalVariance

      private BigInteger[] askForGoalVariance()
      Asks the user for the variance that should be maintained, with the other rules added independently of the families.
      Gibt zurück:
      The User input for goal variance as BigInteger.

    • askForRuleSize

      private int[] askForRuleSize()
      Asks the user for the minimum and maximum size of the other rules.
      Gibt zurück:
      An array containing the minimum and maximum size of the other rules.

    • askForFalseVars

      private int askForFalseVars(SatSolver satSolver, int numberOfVariables) throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
      Asks the user for the percentage of variables that should be always false.
      Parameter:
      satSolver - The SatSolver object
      numberOfVariables - The number of variables in the CNF problem.
      Gibt zurück:
      The number of variables that should be always false.
      Löst aus:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - If the solver times out.

    • askForTrueVars

      private int askForTrueVars(SatSolver satSolver, int numberOfVariables) throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
      Asks the user for the percentage of variables that should be always true.
      Parameter:
      satSolver - The SatSolver object
      numberOfVariables - The number of variables in the CNF problem.
      Gibt zurück:
      The number of variables that should be always true.
      Löst aus:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - If the solver times out.
